objdescid.origination: John Linnell author, inventor, delineator. Blake wrote and signed this receipt, and John Linnell annotated it (see object note).

provenance.name: Yale University Library
provenance.note: John Linnell; from the Linnell collection; sold at Christie's, Dec. 2, 1938 to the dealer W. H. Robinson on behalf on Otis T. Bradley (in Lot 62 £78 15s); presented to Yale University Library by Mr. Otis T. Bradley in 1941 or 1942.

repository.department: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

desc.objtitle:
30 December 1819 Receipt, John Linnell, 30 December 1819,
Object 1 (Bentley Receipt 39)

objnote.p: Blake wrote and signed this receipt, and John Linnell annotated it.

On the left side of the object, there are words written vertically in pencil in Linnell's hand. According to Bentley (*Blake Records*, page 774), "Sideways in the corner of the sheet is written Linnell's note to himself: '2£. to Father Paid by Mr Varley lent 1/6'".

lg.l:
Recievd Received 30 Decembr
December 1819 of MrLinnell the sum Bentley (*Blake Records*, page 774) and Keynes (*Letters*, page 146) read the last word of this line as "sum".
of Fourteen Shillings for Jerusalem Chap Chapter 2
